resources.string:
1.03.1
 	- Critical fix for force close due to the new notification

 1.03
 	- Headset/headphone connection fixes
 	- Improved notification (for Android 3.0+)
 	- Updated UI (for Android 3.0+)
 	- Minor UI enhancements

 1.02
 	- Improved audio focus (e.g. audio ducking for voice navigation apps)
 	- Improved remote control support (e.g. bluetooth enhancements)
 	- Lock-screen support for stock lock-screens (requires Android 4.0+)

 1.01
 	- Filters out notification tones, alarms, and ringtones from the library
 	- Various performance improvements
 	- Improvements to devices with multiple SD cards
 	- Improved the touch friendliness
 	- Improved backend error logging

 1.00
 	- Initial Release
 	- 1x1 and 4x1 Widgets
 	- Dynamic "Now Playing" Playlist
 	- Extensive Settings
 	- "Persisted Shuffle", "Perpetual Shuffle", and "Sequential" Play Modes

Note: The email field is optional. If you would like a follow-up response to your feedback, then you may specify an email address. If your feedback does not incite a response, then your email address will simply be ignored.
Unable to submit feedback. Make sure you are connected to the Internet.
The SD card is currently not accessible. Please either re-insert the SD card or un-mount the SD card as a disk drive.
Specifies settings for headsets and bluetooth devices.
Determines whether or not the default bluetooth device settings should be used.
Determines the action that will occur when headsets and bluetooth devices are connected.
Determines the action that will occur when headsets and bluetooth devices are disconnected.
Bluetooth is turned off. Bluetooth is required to be on to modify device specific settings. Press to turn bluetooth on.
Bluetooth is turning on. Paired bluetooth devices will show momentarily.
Specifies settings for headphones and auxiliary devices.
Determines the action that will occur when headphones and auxiliary devices are connected to the 3.5mm jack.
Determines the action that will occur when headphones and auxiliary devices are disconnected from the 3.5mm jack.
Specifies settings for the media should be played.
Specifies the status of the repeat action, whether it be repeating the playlist, the song, or no repeat.
Specifies how to play media in the playlist. Persisted shuffle is guaranteed to NEVER repeat a song until all songs have been played.
Determines whether or not the queue of upcoming songs in the playlist should be cleared when the play mode option changes.
The \'Smart\' option will restart the current song or play the previous song depending on how much of the song has played.
Specifies the condition of how much the current song must have played before the previous button will instead restart the song.
Determines whether or not the screen should light up when a song changes, only if the screen is not already lit up.
Determines when the notification icon should be displayed.
Determines whether or not a mini-player will overlay the current application when the notification icon is clicked.
Specifies settings for controlling the volume.
Specifies what the media volume will be set to if headphones and headsets are disconnected. Disabled does not update the volume.
Specifies what the media volume will be set to if headphones and auxiliary devices are connected. Disabled does not update the volume.
Specifies what the media volume will be set to if headsets and bluetooth devices are connected. Disabled does not update the volume.
Determines whether or not error logs are automatically recorded. It is STRONGLY recommended that this remains enabled.
Determines whether or not playback will resume after it was automatically paused for an event (phone calls, SD card mounting, etc.).
